RelationshipElement.name: Context - Height
RelationshipElement.description: A 1-to-n relationship between the parent and its children, respectively.

RelationshipElement.name: Context - Matrix
RelationshipElement.description: A 1-to-n relationship between the parent and its children, respectively.

RelationshipElement.name: Context - FCN
RelationshipElement.description: A 1-to-n relationship between the parent and its children, respectively.

RelationshipElement.name: Context - Photograph Log
RelationshipElement.description: A 1-to-n relationship between the parent and its children, respectively.

RelationshipElement.name: Context Group - Photograph Log
RelationshipElement.description: A 1-to-n relationship between the parent and its children, respectively.

RelationshipElement.name: Context Group - Context
RelationshipElement.description: A 1-to-n relationship between the parent and its children, respectively.

RelationshipElement.name: Bonded To
RelationshipElement.description: Implements a bonded to for loci

RelationshipElement.name: Arbitrarily separated from
RelationshipElement.description: When two or more locus codes have been assigned to what is ultimately determined to be the same locus

RelationshipElement.name: Broadly contemporary with
RelationshipElement.description: Loci suspected to be contemporary but no direct physical relationship or evidence (i.e. adjacent buildings)

RelationshipElement.name: EarlierLater
RelationshipElement.description: Implements a Stratigraphically Immediately Earlier-Later for loci.

ArchaeologicalElement.name: Context
ArchaeologicalElement.description: The physical result of any single action whether it leaves a positive or negative record within the stratigraphic sequence. (MoLAS 1994)

property.name: Context Context ID
property.description: Every archaeological locus (negative element (cut), deposit, structure, skeleton, artefact cluster) is given a unique 3 or 4 letter locus code. Each trench is designated with a separate letter which starts the code, so it is immediately obvious to which trench a locus belongs. For example locus HAA belongs to Trench H, locus MQP to Trench M etc. The loci are labelled consecutively in alphabetical order using the letters following the trench letter. For Trench H the first locus would be HAA, the second HAB, the third HAB and so on. In addition sets of letters can denote parts of trenches, buildings etc. E.g. HFs might denote loci from a specific building. Burial locus codes begin with the letter Z, followed by the trench letter. Hence burial ZHA is the first burial locus from trench H. Check with the trench supervisor who will assign the locus code from the central register.

property.name: Context Type
property.description: Describe the locus type by selecting an icon as defined below. When you have selected a locus type you can proceed to open the "Fill in locus type details" page. Note this page will not open unless you have selected a locus type.

lookup.term: {Cut} Any Locus which represents the removal of earlier deposit and thus forms a negative interface (cut) with another locus, such as a cut for a pit, burial, ditch, wall foundation or robber trench.
{Deposit} Any Locus with deposited sediment and soil, such as floor layers, pit and grave fills, hearth fills and natural sediments.
{Natural} Any Locus with deposited sediment and soil, such as floor layers, pit and grave fills, hearth fills and natural sediments.
{Feature_Part} Any Locus consisting of deliberately constructed structural element, independent of a Negative Element (i.e. cut, such as a wall or a hearth).

property.name: Context AreaCode
property.formatString: -Trench-$2

property.name: Date Opened
property.description: Date on which the Locus was first excavated. This will automatically be set to the date on which the locus is recorded but can be edited using the keyboard.

property.name: Trench Dimensions
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: Context Name
property.description: Enter a brief, clear name for the Context eg 'House A - west wall'
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: Grid X
property.description: The X coordinate on the SW corner of the locus.
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: Grid Y
property.description: The Y coordinate on the SW corner of the locus.
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: Team Members
property.description: Initials of the excavators that have worked on the locus.
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: Excavation Method
property.description: Enter details here about the method of archaeological excavation.
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

lookup.term: {Other} Excavated by another method. Add details in Annotation field.

property.name: Horizon Boundary
property.description: Describe the boundary between this and the next locus.
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

lookup.term: {Doubtful} You are uncertain of whether you accurately excavated a boundary between deposits
{Ambiguous} You are uncertain as to whether there was a boundary between loci.
{Merging} There is a distinction between the excavated locus and earlier locus/loci but the excavated loci and the earlier loci grade into each other
{Clear} The boundary with the earlier locus/loci was very clearly defined during excavation.
{ArbitrarySpit} There is no meaningful boundary with an earlier locus. The boundary has been artificially created by the excavation process.

property.name: Contamination
property.description: The extent to which the locus has been contaminated.
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

lookup.term: {Contaminated} Contaminated by later material eg by unidentified cut at time of initial excavation by large scale animal or root activity which were not isolated by excavation by excavation processes some annoying person mixed the material or stuff fell into deposit from the section.

{High_likelihood_high_amount_derived} It is very likely that significant amounts of earlier artifact and ecofact material has become incorporated in the deposit. For example; is this locus a mud brick wall or other structure or building or structural debris or a deposit which has seen the redeposition of material excavated from cuts. These are all situations in which earlier material is likely to have been dug up and re-used (in the mud brick) or re-deposited (when digging out pits).
{Low_likelihood_low_amount_derived} You think there is little chance that very much earlier material has made it's way into this deposit.

{Primary_deposit} You are very sure that the deposit and all finds therein directly relate to activity within a specific period of time and there is thus minimal amounts of derived material and no contamination.

property.name: Plans

property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: Volume
property.description: Estimate the volume of the locus in litres. All soil will be collected in buckets of a known volume. A tally should be kept of buckets produced from a locus and the total volume calculated using that tally.
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: Cut Your Interpretation
property.description: Your interpretation of the likely function of the Locus using standardised definitions.
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

lookup.term: {Other} Function not elsewhere described. Provide details in Annotation field.

property.name: Shape of Cut
property.description: Describe the shape of the negative element/cut viewed from above.
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

lookup.term: {Linear} Straight sided but not square or rectangular.
{Rectangular} Two sides longer than the other.

property.name: Shape of Cut - Note
property.description: Additional notes about the shape of the cut.
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.description: Describe the shape of any visible corners of the negative element/cut.
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: Break of Slope - Top
property.description: The degree with which the top surface of the edge of the cut breaks into the sides.
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

lookup.term: {Not_perceptible} Well-rounded; there is no perceptible difference between the sides of the cut and the surface into which it protrudes.

property.name: Break of Slope - Base
property.description: The degree with which the top surface of the edge of the cut breaks into the sides.
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

lookup.term: {Not_perceptible} Well-rounded; there is no perceptible difference between the sides of the cut and the surface into which it protrudes.

property.name: Sides of Cut
property.description: Describe the shape of the cut as seen in cross section.
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: Shape of Base
property.description: The shape of the base of the cut in profile.
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: Orientation
property.description: Orientation of linear cuts eg N-S.
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: Inclination of axis
property.description: Inclination of the axis of post- and stakeholes.
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: Truncation
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: CG Context Type
property.description: Enter the type of feature you are describing.
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

lookup.term: {Negative_Element} Any Locus which forms a negative interface (cut) with another locus, such as a cut for a pit, burial, ditch, wall foundation or robber trench.
{Deposit} Any Locus with deposited sediment and soil, such as floor layers, pit and grave fills, hearth fills and natural sediments.
{Structure} Any Locus consisting of deliberately constructed structures, independent of a Negative Element (i.e. cut, such as walls and hearths).
{Wall} A structured vertical barrier made from durable materials defining a space.
{Floor} A prepared surface, internal or external, including those made from plaster, earth etc.
{Well} A deep pit excavated to reach the water table.
{Pit} A large cut filled with sediment or other materials.
{Room} A discrete space within a house or other building.
{Burial} The cut, fill plus any associated structures relating to the deposition of human remains, including those remains, such as a skeleton.
{Building} A building is defined when several walls surround a discrete space
{Surface} A compacted horizontal layer, internal or external, on which activities took place.
{Space} A space is an area bounded by a structure of some kind, either external or internal, and can be for example a courtyard, room, ante-room etc.
{Posthole} A small pit cut to hold an upright post.
{Stakehole} Cuts smaller than postholes, typically c. 1-5 cm diameter.
{Hearth} A prepared structure in which a fire is set.
{Stakehole_row} A row of cuts smaller than postholes, typically c. 1-5 cm diameter.
{Other} Function not elsewhere described. Provide details in Annotation field.

property.name: CG Your description
property.description: Describe the feature, any details of dimensions, disturbance, orientation etc.
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: CG Your Discussion
property.description: Add here any elaborations on the interpretation and description.
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: Feature Length
property.description: Longest dimension in metres.
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: Feature Width
property.description: Width or diameter in metres.
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: Feature Top Depth m
property.description: Depth or Height in metres.
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: Feature Bottom Depth m
property.description: Depth or Height in metres.
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: CG Mid X
property.description: An appropriate mid-point on the feature should be recorded on the X/Y coordinates. This will locate the feature on the site grid system.
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: CG Mid Y
property.description: An appropriate mid-point on the feature should be recorded on the X/Y coordinates. This will locate the feature on the site grid system.
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: CG Phase Notes
property.description: The site or building phase in which this feature was constructed or deposited.
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: CG Plans
property.description: Reference numbers to plans or drawings of this feature.
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: CG Section Numbers
property.description: Reference numbers to section drawings of this feature
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: Deposit Your Interpretation
property.description: Your interpretation of the likely function of the locus.
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

lookup.term: {Indeterminate} You are unable to make an assessment of possible function.
{Packing} Packing in a post hole for post material fulfilling a constructional purpose other than deliberate levelling deposits.
{Makeup_Levelling} Material laid down to level or raise an area for constructional purposes or other activities.
{Dump} Material probably dumped as a result of other activity e.g. material removed from cuts or other constructional or destructional activity.
{Midden} Distinct area of organic rubbish accumulation
{Burial} A fill or other deposit associated with a skeleton and forming part of a burial feature.
{Structural_Debris_Collapse} Material derived from collapse of a wall, roof or other structure
{Partly_naturally_derived} A deposit partly or wholly accumulating through natural sedimentary processes, such as water or wind deposition.

{Wholly_naturally_derived} All of the deposit accumulating through the deposition of natural sediments through geomorphological processes eg wind borne sediments water-laid natural sediments material flaking from cave and rock shelter walls.
{Erosional_products} Material deriving from the erosion of earlier archaeological sediments.
{Artifact_Cluster} A distinct concentration of artifacts or ecofacts. Make sure you record its xyz coordinates centre and edges.
{Ash_Charcoal} A deposit consisting largely of carbonized/charred plant material and/or ash

{Arbitrary} This applies to artificial loci excavated for excavational convenience eg section cleaning material whose precise provenience is unclear. Does not include arbitrary spits or spatial units deliberately excavated for finer control of horizontal and vert

{Distinct_floor_contact} To be used for material that directly reflects the use of a surface or floor - artefact material on the surface perhaps thin deposits of occupation material. These loci will be gridded into spatial units for closer control of artifact distributions.
{Animal_Plant} Deposit derived from plant or animal activity
{Other} Function not elsewhere described. Provide details in Annotation field.

property.name: Soil Compaction Type
property.description: Describe the compaction of the sediments in the Locus.
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

lookup.term: {Friable} Deposit disintegrates into small particles under pressure.
{Crumbly} Deposit disintegrates into lumps under pressure.

property.name: Soil Compaction Description
property.description: Description of the compaction of soil including changes throughout the deposit. Eg "Varies from loose to compact."
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: Soil Particle Sorting
property.description: Assessment of the frequency with which particles of the same size occur.
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

lookup.term: {Moderately_sorted} Particles are mostly the same size and evenly distributed but there are some larger particles.
{Poorly_sorted} Particles are different sizes and unevenly distributed.
{Very_poorly_sorted} Particles are very different sizes and very unevenly distributed.
{Well_sorted} Particles are roughly the same size and evenly distributed.

property.name: Soil Texture
property.description: The type of sediment, eg clay, silt, sand and loam. Use the Material Helper or a Soil Sediment diagram for assisance.
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

lookup.term: {No_Observation} No Observation. Use the Texture helper to prefil this.
{Sand} A sand has a loose gritty feel and does not stick together. Individual sand grains can be seen or felt. (VDEPI 2009: AG0058)
{Loamy_Sand} In a loamy sand particles barely stick together and a moulded piece of soil just holds its shape. (VDEPI 2009: AG0058)
{Silty_Clay_Loam} A silty clay loam is like a clay loam but silty as well and smooth to the touch. (VDEPI 2009: AG0058)

{Clay_Loam} More easily moulded into a shape than a loam a clay loam rolls out to a thin ribbon between the palms while a loam will break-up. When dry a clay loam will form a lump but is not as tough to break as a clay.(VDEPI 2009: AG0058)
{Sandy_Clay_Loam} A sandy clay loam is like a clay loam but sand grains can be felt (and heard - see Sandy Loam) (VDEPI 2009: AG0058)

{Silt_Loam} A silty loam is like a loam but has a smooth silky feel when a moist sample is pushed between the index finger and thumb. On drying a sample can form a hard lump but this may be broken by hand. (VDEPI 2009: AG0058)

{Loam} A loam breaks into crumbs but will tend to stick together. Sand grains cannot be felt in a moist sample which when squeezed will retain its shape when handled freely. Loams are usually soft to the feel. (VDEPI 2009: AG0058)

{Sandy_Loam} A sandy loam sticks together more than a loamy sand but can be easily broken. Individual sand grains can be felt and heard if a wet sample is rubbed between the index finger and thumb and held close to the ear. (VDEPI 2009: AG0058)
{Silty_Clay} A silty clay is like a clay but smoother. (VDEPI 2009: AG0058)

{Clay} Clays are tough and can be moulded into shapes when moist. Clays form a long flexible ribbon when rubbed between the palms and the ribbon can often be bent into a U shape without breaking. Clays dry into very hard clods. (VDEPI 2009: AG0058)
{Sandy_Clay} A sandy clay is like a clay but sand grains can be felt (and heard - see Sandy Loam). (VDEPI 2009: AG0058)

property.name: Soil Colour
property.description: Broad colour description of the soil, eg 'mid greyish brown'.
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: Soil Munsel Color
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: Composition Type
property.description: Describe the structure of the Locus sediment. The components making up the structure are added below as aggregates.
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

lookup.term: {Heterogeneous} Deposit with different mixed components which need to be described.
{Laminated} Laminated Deposit consists of lots of fine lenses of the same material. Compact laminated Deposit consists of a number of fine lenses of different materials.
{Compact_Laminated} Deposit consists of a number of fine lenses of different materials

property.name: Deposit Bedding
property.description: Describes the base of the deposit
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

lookup.term: {Uneven} Mix of horizontal, oblique and undulating - make sure you describe this

property.name: Sterile
property.description: Whether or not the deposit is sterile, ie contains no artefacts
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: Deposit Inclusions
property.description: Enter a brief description of inclusions (eg stone flecks artefacts).
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: Location
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: Skeleton Dimensions
property.description: Record the approximate extent of the skeletal remains (in meters or millimetres only) and the axis of measurement. Detailed dimensions can be taken from the plan.
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: Skeleton Head
property.description: Which way up the head faces and/or points
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: Skeleton Body
property.description: Describe the attitude of the body, whether it is extended, crouched, flexed, supine (front up), prone (face down) and the orientation.
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: Skeleton Left Arm
property.description: Record whether left arm is straight or flexed, is along the side of the body, over the chest or on the pelvis, and the position of the hand.
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: Skeleton Right Arm
property.description: Record whether right arm is straight or flexed, is along the side of the body, over the chest or on the pelvis, and the position of the hand.
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: Skeleton Left Leg
property.description: Record whether the leg is straight or bent, crossed left over right or right over left and the position of the foot
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: Skeleton Right Leg
property.description: Record whether the leg is straight or bent, crossed left over right or right over left and the position of the foot
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: Skeleton Condition
property.description: Describe the general condition of the skeleton and any comments on articulation. Any degeneration of bone in situ is important to record as well as accidental damage during excavation and lifting. Record disturbances through later activity or animal/root activity as well as damage due to stone pressure on the bones. It is important to note whether the patellae, hyoid, phalanges, basi-occipital etc are present or not, and their location, as this may give an indication of the state of the body at the time of interment.
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: Skeleton Surface Modifications
property.description: Note any cut marks, evidence of stains and/or colour during the course of the excavation, burning, chewing marks, root activity etc.
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: Skeleton Environment
property.description: The physical environment at the time of excavation may affect the state of the bone therefore it is important to note the weather and conditions you are working in.
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: Skeleton Days Exposed
property.description: It is important to excavate skeletal remains as quickly as possible as the state of the bone will change during exposure. Any conditional change should also be noted. Excavate as quickly as possible because the bones will degrade rapidly.
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: Target A X
property.description: The X coordinate of Target A. Targets are white-painted, large-headed nails used to rectify photographs.
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: Target A Y
property.description: The Y coordinate of Target A. Targets are white-painted, large-headed nails used to rectify photographs.
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: Target A Z
property.description: The Z coordinate of Target A. Targets are white-painted, large-headed nails used to rectify photographs.
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: Target B X
property.description: The X coordinate of Target B. Targets are white-painted, large-headed nails used to rectify photographs.
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: Target B Y
property.description: The Y coordinate of Target B. Targets are white-painted, large-headed nails used to rectify photographs.
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: Target B Z
property.description: The Z coordinate of Target B. Targets are white-painted, large-headed nails used to rectify photographs.
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: Target C X
property.description: The X coordinate of Target C. Targets are white-painted, large-headed nails used to rectify photographs.
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: Target C Y
property.description: The Y coordinate of Target C. Targets are white-painted, large-headed nails used to rectify photographs.
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: Target C Z
property.description: The Z coordinate of Target C. Targets are white-painted, large-headed nails used to rectify photographs.
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: Target D X
property.description: The X coordinate of Target D. Targets are white-painted, large-headed nails used to rectify photographs.
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: Target D Y
property.description: The Y coordinate of Target D. Targets are white-painted, large-headed nails used to rectify photographs.
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: Target D Z
property.description: The Z coordinate of Target D. Targets are white-painted, large-headed nails used to rectify photographs.
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: Skeleton Notes
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: Your description
property.description: Enter a verbal description of the Locus, including its form, loci, relationship to other Loci and any other relevant information. This is the main place to record all other descriptive information that may be treated briefly or not covered elsewhere, including signs of disturbance by burrowing animals etc.
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: Your Discussion
property.description: Enter an interpretation of the function of the Locus and its place in the stratigraphical sequence.
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: Photo
property.description: Use this button to take a photo of the locus using the camera on the tablet. Use a scale in the photo
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: Soil Texture Helper
property.description: This helper is based on the standard flow chart for determining soil texture. Start by taking 25g of soil and placing it in your palm. Select each option and follow the prompts for TASKS (like roll ribbon) until you get a result, eg 'silty loam'. Then click the 'Update' button to have that value pasted onto your Locus record.
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: Device Code
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: Site Code
property.description: Short code to signify the excavation site and often the year of excavation. Assigned automatically by the module.
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: SearchHelp
property.description: This allows you to find any loci that contain your search term or string in any field in a locus record. Type in your term/string and press the "Search" button. Press "My Loci" to return to the full list of loci for this trench.
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: Context Group ID
property.description: Feature number taken from the central register.

property.name: Context Group AreaCode
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: CG Your description
property.description: Describe the feature, any details of dimensions, disturbance, orientation etc.
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: CG Your Interpretation
property.description: Describe your understanding of the feature function, phasing etc.
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: Your Discussion
property.description: Add here any elaborations on the interpretation and description.
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: Length
property.description: Longest dimension in metres.
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: Width
property.description: Width or diameter in metres.
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: Top Depth m
property.description: Depth or Height in metres.
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: Bottom Depth m
property.description: Depth or Height in metres.
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: Mid X
property.description: An appropriate mid-point on the feature should be recorded on the X/Y coordinates. This will locate the feature on the site grid system.
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: Mid Y
property.description: An appropriate mid-point on the feature should be recorded on the X/Y coordinates. This will locate the feature on the site grid system.
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: CG Plans
property.description: Reference numbers to plans or drawings of this feature.
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: CG Section Numbers
property.description: Reference numbers to section drawings of this feature
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: Photo
property.description: Use this button to take a photo of the feature using the camera on the tablet. Remember to include a scale in the photo.
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: Device Code
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: Site Code
property.description: Short code to signify the excavation site and often the year of excavation. Assigned automatically by the module.
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: Component
property.description: Describe the components which make up 10% or more of the deposit.

lookup.term: {Midden} Organic debris e.g. bones carbonised material phytoliths etc
{Mudbrick} Fragments of mudbrick or whole mudbricks not part of a coherent structural element.
{Ash} White/grey fine material which may contain charcoal and other burnt plant material.
{Artefacts} Human manufactured materials including lithics, beads, ground stone etc.

property.name: Percentage
property.description: Enter the approximate % volume of this material in the Locus.

property.name: Shape
property.description: Shape and roundness of stones and pebbles in the deposit.
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

lookup.term: {Dressed_Stone} Those that have been clearly shaped for use.
{Tabular} Stones with flattened upper and lower surfaces.
{Ground} Stones that have been deliberately shaped smooth by grinding.

property.name: Context ID
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: AreaCode
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: Height Context ID
property.formatString: Loc-$2-

property.name: Number
property.description: Add a short description of the point being recorded, for example, 1. North edge of floor, 2. South edge of floor. Mark your points on the sketch for each locus.
property.formatString: Height-$2-

property.name: X
property.description: Add X coordinate using the site grid

property.name: Y
property.description: Add Y coordinate using the site grid

property.name: Z
property.description: Add Z coordinate using the site grid

property.name: Notes
property.description: Add a description here concerning the entity whose position you have recorded
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: AreaCode
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

ArchaeologicalElement.name: Photograph Log
ArchaeologicalElement.description: A record of images created and stored on another device, eg by a professional site photographer.

property.name: Photo Context ID
property.description: Unique number or code for each Locus
property.formatString: Loc-$2-

property.name: Photo Context Group ID
property.description: Unique number or code for each Stratum/Feature
property.formatString: Strat-$2-

property.name: Photograph Reference ID
property.description: Unique number or code allocated by creator of the image. It could be a filename or a reference number
property.formatString: Photo-$2

property.name: Scene Type
property.description: The type of scene captured, eg opening or closing view of the Locus. (Vocab: Open, Close, Other)
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

lookup.term: {Open} Photograph taken on opening the Locus.
{Close} Photograph taken on closing the Locus.
{Other} Scene not elsewhere described. Enter detail into Annotation field.

property.name: Photograph Description
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: AreaCode
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: Device Code
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: Site Code
property.description: Short code to signify the excavation site and often the year of excavation
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: Title
property.description: Give your entry a simple, short title, such as Daily Trench Update, Burial 34, Storm Damage. Note that diary entries allow you to add information in addition to the locus, feature and artefact records elsewhere in the module and should not be the primary description point for those entities
property.formatString: Diary-$2

property.name: Diary timestamp
property.description: The date this entry is created will automatically appear here

property.name: Diary author
property.description: Your name will be added here based on your login

property.name: Text
property.description: Record your diary entry here in as much detail as necessary and append with photographs, video and/or audio
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: Photo
property.description: Use this button to take a photo relevant to this entry using the camera on the tablet
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: Site Name
property.formatString: FCN-$2

property.name: AreaCode
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}

property.name: Context ID
property.description: Every archaeological locus (negative element (cut), deposit, structure, skeleton, artefact cluster) is given a unique 3 or 4 letter locus code. Each trench is designated with a separate letter which starts the code, so it is immediately obvious to which trench a locus belongs. For example locus HAA belongs to Trench H, locus MQP to Trench M etc. The loci are labelled consecutively in alphabetical order using the letters following the trench letter. For Trench H the first locus would be HAA, the second HAB, the third HAB and so on. In addition sets of letters can denote parts of trenches, buildings etc. E.g. HFs might denote loci from a specific building. Burial locus codes begin with the letter Z, followed by the trench letter. Hence burial ZHA is the first burial locus from trench H. Check with the trench supervisor who will assign the locus code from the central register.
property.formatString: {{if $1 then $1}}{{if and($1, $2) then " " }}{{if $2 then $2}}{{if $3 then " ($3)"}}{{if between($4,0,0.49) then "??" elsif lessThan($4,1) then "?" }}
